characters.name: Leopold Bloom
characters.description: Married to Molly Bloom. His son Rudy died 11 days after birth, which he blames himself for, leading to a decade-long withdrawal from intimacy. Molly is having an affair with Blazes Boylan, while Bloom maintains an emotional correspondence with Martha Clifford. He masturbates to Gerty MacDowell on the beach. Superstitious, he carries a shriveled potato taken by Zoe Higgins. During his visit to Bella Cohen's brothel, he experiences elaborate hallucinations including delusions of grandeur, a dominatrix fantasy, and a courtroom trial of his guilts.

characters.name: Stephen Dedalus
characters.description: A moody former Jesuit trainee and aspiring artist. Roommates and frenemy of Buck Mulligan. Struggles with faith following the recent death of his mother, May Dedalus. Deeply introspective and academically inclined.

characters.name: Simon Dedalus
characters.description: Stephen’s father. Lost his position after Charles Parnell’s scandal. Now an alcoholic who fails to provide for his family. Skilled in wordplay and insults.

characters.name: Malachi "Buck" Mulligan
characters.description: Wealthy and privileged. Lodges with Stephen and hosts Haines. Well-liked for bawdy humor, except by Stephen, Simon, and Bloom.

characters.name: The Citizen
characters.description: A xenophobic bar regular modeled on the Cyclops. Throws a biscuit tin at Bloom after a dispute in Barney Kiernan's Pub.

characters.name: Hugh "Blazes" Boylan
characters.description: Molly Bloom’s tour manager and lover. Known as a dashing man about town.

characters.name: Haines
characters.description: Stays at Martello Tower to study Irish culture. Prone to night terrors and condescension.

characters.name: Mr. Deasey
characters.description: Stephen’s employer. Conservative and pro-British. Writes a mocked letter about foot-and-mouth disease.

characters.name: Patrick "Paddy" Dignam
characters.description: Recently deceased alcoholic. His funeral occurs during the novel. Appears in Bloom’s hallucination claiming to be present by metempsychosis.

characters.name: Lenehan
characters.description: Freeloader and flirt. His horse tip loses while Bloom’s wins.

characters.name: A.E. (George Russell)
characters.description: Mystic poet of the Irish Literary Revival. Consulted like an oracle.

characters.name: Miles Crawford
characters.description: Head of the Freeman’s Journal newsroom. Impatient and drunken. Symbolically linked to Aeolus.

characters.name: Ritchie Goulding
characters.description: Simon Dedalus’s brother-in-law. Overstates his professional importance.

characters.name: Corny Kelleher
characters.description: Jovial funeral arranger who frequently says, 'Do you follow me?'

characters.name: Rudy Bloom
characters.description: Bloom’s son who died 11 days after birth. Appears in Bloom’s hallucinations.

characters.name: Molly Bloom
characters.description: Married to Leopold Bloom. Having an affair with Boylan. Clever, opinionated, and frustrated by the lack of intimacy in her marriage.

characters.name: Gerty MacDowell
characters.description: Young woman with a limp. Meets Bloom’s gaze on the beach during a voyeuristic scene.

characters.name: May Dedalus
characters.description: Stephen’s deceased mother whose memory haunts him.

characters.name: Martha Clifford
characters.description: Bloom’s flirtatious pen pal under the alias Henry Flower.

characters.name: Mina Purefoy
characters.description: Endures a prolonged labor before giving birth.

characters.name: Lydia Douce
characters.description: Flirtatious barmaid at the Ormond Hotel with a crush on Boylan.

characters.name: Mina Kennedy
characters.description: More reserved barmaid at the Ormond Hotel.

characters.name: Bella Cohen
characters.description: Brothel-mistress who dominates Bloom in his hallucinations.

characters.name: Zoe Higgins
characters.description: Playful worker who takes Bloom’s potato.

characters.name: Mrs. Josie Breen
characters.description: Former romantic interest of Bloom, now married to Denis Breen.

characters.name: Cissy Caffrey
characters.description: Friend of Gerty, looking after younger children.

characters.name: Edy Boardman
characters.description: Prudish friend of Gerty.

characters.name: Millicent "Milly" Bloom
characters.description: Bloom’s 15-year-old daughter studying photography in Mullingar.

characters.name: Dilly Dedalus
characters.description: Stephen’s younger sister struggling after her mother’s death.
